text.div:
Generated Narrative: StructureDefinition Subject

NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Subject 0..*BaseA.1.1 - Identification and A.1.2 - related contact information of the Patient/subject
subjectIdentification 1..1BaseA.1.1 - Identification of the patient/subject
given 1..*stringA.1.1.1 - Given name
family 1..*stringA.1.1.2 - Family name/surname
birthDate 1..1dateTimeA.1.1.3 - Date of birth
identifier 1..*IdentifierA.1.1.4 - National healthcare patient ID
nationality 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.1.5 - Nationality
gender 1..1CodeableConceptA.1.1.6 - Gender
countryOfAffiliation 0..1CodeableConceptA.1.1.7 - Country of affiliation
subjectContact 0..1BaseA.1.2 - Patient/subject related contact information
personalContact 0..1BaseA.1.2.1 - Patient address
address 0..*AddressA.1.2.1.1 - Address
telecom 0..*ContactPointA.1.2.1.2 - Telecom
preferredHP 0..*BaseA.1.2.2 - Preferred health professional (HP) - This section can be repeated and linked to any specific information in the document, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the rare disease specialist responsible for the care of the individual patient (this section).
identifier 0..*IdentifierA.1.2.2.1 - Identifier of the HP
name 1..1HumanNameA.1.2.2.2 - Name of the HP
role 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.2.2.3 - Role of the HP
organization 0..1BaseA.1.2.2.4 - HP Organisation
address 0..1AddressA.1.2.2.5 - Address
telecom 0..*ContactPointA.1.2.2.6 - Telecom
contactPerson 0..*BaseA.1.2.3 - Contact person/ legal guardian (multiple contacts could be provided)
role 0..*CodeableConceptA.1.2.3.1 - Role of that person
relationship 0..1CodeableConceptA.1.2.3.2 - Relationship level
given 1..*stringA.1.2.3.4 - Given name
family 1..*stringA.1.2.3.5 - Family name/surname
address 0..*AddressA.1.2.3.6 - Address
telecom 0..*ContactPointA.1.2.3.7 - Telecom
organization 0..1BaseA.1.2.3.8 - Contact person organisation

Documentation for this format

name: SubjectHdrEhn
title: A.1.1 - Identification and A.1.2 - related contact information of the Patient/subject
description: Hospital Discharge Report - Hospital Discharge Report subject data element - A.1.1 and A.1.2 eHN
copyright: Used by permission of HL7 Europe, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

element.short: A.1.1 - Identification and A.1.2 - related contact information of the Patient/subject
element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report - Hospital Discharge Report subject data element - A.1.1 and A.1.2 eHN
Identification of the patient/subject
The given name/first name of the patient (also known as forename or first name). This field can contain more than one element.
The family name/surname/last name of the patient. This field can contain more than one element or multiple fields could be present.
Complete date, following the ISO 8601.
An identifier of the patient that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National ID (birth number) for a Czech patient. Multiple identifiers could be provided
Nationality of the patient.
This field must contain a recognised valid value for "administrative gender". If different, "physiological gender" should be communicated elsewhere in the relevant clinical information section.
Name of country of affiliation
Patient/subject related contact information
Patient address

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated with a person, such as phone number, email, or messaging service. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.

element.short: A.1.2.2 - Preferred health professional (HP) - This section can be repeated and linked to any specific information in the document, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the rare disease specialist responsible for the care of the individual patient (this section).
element.definition: Preferred health professional (HP) - This section can be repeated and linked to any specific information in the document, for example a link between a rare disease problem and the rare disease specialist responsible for the care of the individual patient (this section).
An identifier of the health professional that is unique within a defined scope. Example: National health professional ID. Multiple identifiers could be provided.
Name of the health professional that has been treating or taking responsibility for the patient.[the structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname)]
Health professional role. Multiple roles could be provided.
Health professional organisation

Mailing and home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated with a person, such as phone number, email, or messaging service. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.

element.short: A.1.2.3 - Contact person/ legal guardian (multiple contacts could be provided)
element.definition: Contact person/ legal guardian (multiple contacts could be provided)
Role of the contact person: legal guardian, next of kin, other person to contact.
Relationship type with the patient (e.g. father, wife, daughter)
Given name of the contact person/guardian . This field can contain more than one element.
Family name of the contact person. This field can contain more than one element [the structure of the name will be the same as for the patient (given name, family name / surname)]..

Mailing, home or office addresses. The addresses are always sequences of address parts (e.g. street address line, country, postcode, city) even if postal address formats may vary depending on the country. An address may or may not include a specific use code; if this attribute is not present it is assumed to be the default address useful for any purpose.
Telecommunication contact information (addresses) associated with a person, such as phone number, email, or messaging service. Multiple telecommunication addresses might be provided.
Contact person organisation information.
